list_definition.definition: a high steep rock, especially one facing the sea

list_ex_of_english: The performance took place along a cliff top which dropped to a lagoon protected from the ocean by a thick sand dune.
The deer runs towards a cliff, stops, tips his head and the boy falls into a pond.
Significantly some of these dates are from cliff sections exposed in relatively higher areas, which now appear to be potentially erosional areas.
A fitness cliff model could potentially explain the core dilemma of psychiatric genetics.
The ice cliff itself nowhere showed any stepped formation.
His wife brought his body halfway up a cliff.
Distinct layers of firn were observed to the south, where the ice cap ends in a small cliff of 19 m in height.
The lithostratigraphy of the cores has been precisely correlated with the nearby cliff section, which has also been examined and re-described.
